str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make like, liken; I compare. From homoios; to assimilate, i.e. Compare; passively, to become similar.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To compare (settle) accounts, make a reckoning. From sun and airo; to make up together, i.e. to compute.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
